some victims of past attacks are upset to be excluded, and charities and relief agencies, which have raised more than $675 million, worry that federal funds may go only to families of those killed or injured in attacks, who are already main recipients of private charity; police blame dissident republicans for murder and for bombing of empty bus outside West Belfast police station (S)')('2001103', 'Case of inhalation anthrax in New York City hospital worker Kathy T Nguyen calls into question assumptions about outbreak for which scientific and medical wisdom was already being rapidly revised; officials struggling to explain case admit how much they do not know; nearly every assumption about anthrax has been challenged, if not disproven, since first case was diagnosed in Sept; finely ground anthrax, it now seems, can form lethal mist when delivered in mail; powerful antibiotics can offer fighting chance of survival even after symptoms have appeared; amount of spores needed to produced deadly inhalation form of disease could be far smaller than previously thought; little data exists on how infection takes hold in humans or how outbreak moves through populations; there is enormous uncertainty over who might have capability to produce weapons-grade anthrax since technology to make finely ground particles is widely available; anthrax glossary; photos (M)')('2001103', 'New Jersey Devils defeat Boston Bruins, 4-3, Boston (M)')('2001103', 'Drug companies ask for government contracts to undertake research on bioterrorism drugs, creating uneasy debate among executives, politicians and consumer advocates; central issue is who should pay for development and stockpiling of vaccines and antibiotics to protect civilians against deliberate release of deadly diseases like anthrax and smallpox (M)')('2001103', 'Traces of anthrax are discovered in two more Washington post offices, and Bush administration officials acknowledged they cannot guarantee that mails are free of contamination;
